item.title: dinnertable: A 20-Seat Speakeasy-Style Restaurant
item.description:
dinnertable: A 20-Seat Speakeasy-Style Restaurant

The sign beside the interior door reads "Press for Food." If you're in front of it, you've just walked through the bustling East Village cocktail bar The Garret East, beyond a curtain, into a petite corridor. A push of the analog button sends a chime to the inside and you're promptly greeted.

item.title: 7 Pimm's Cup recipes for spring.
item.description:
7 Pimm's Cup recipes for spring.

If Spring had an official cocktail, the Pimm's Cup would be it. It's ultra-refreshing, bright and vibrant-and as easy to make as it is to drink. To mix a basic version of the classic British cocktail, all you need is Pimm's No. 1, ginger ale (or some sort of lemon-lime soda), cucumber and lemon.

item.title: Colossal
item.description:
Colossal

Commercial photographer Sam Kaplan 's latest project, transforms sticks of chewing gum into monumental structures, stacking the sticky treat in shapes that imitate architectural forms. Hundreds of pieces of gum criss cross and stand upwards to create pyramids, columns, and arches-held tightly together with support from super glue.
